titleStmt.title: A noble riddle wisele expounded: or, The maids answer to the knights three questions She with her excellent wit and civil carriage, vvon a young knight to joyn with her in marriage. This gallant couple now are man and wife, and she with him doth lead a pleasant life. The tune is Lay the bent to the bonny broom.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and W. Gilbertson,

notesStmt.note: Place of publication from Wing, which suggests publication date is 1658-1664.
With four woodcut illustrations at head.
Verse - "There was a lady of the North Country,".
Reproduction of the original in the Glasgow University library.
